page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: We carried out the survey on two days. The first day was a dry Sunday and the second was a rainy Monday. There were 90 cars there on the Sunday and only 17 cars on the Monday. People were watching hand gliding, walking the dog or having a picnic. Most came from 30 to 40 km away. Nearly all came by car. The average amount of people in a party was two. On the Monday the average time spent there was one to two hours. On Sunday it was more. Up there, there are two car parks and a small ecological museum. By Neil Westley.
